question.text: Among the following statements, incorrect statement is

options.text: The oceanic reservoir regulates the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere
It is estimated that 4 × 10<sup>10</sup> kg of carbon is fixed in the biosphere through photosynthesis annually.
Of the total quantity of global carbon, 71% carbon is found dissolved in ocean.
Carbon constitutes 49% of the dry weight of organisms and is next to the water.

solution.text: Carbon cycling takes place through atmosphere, ocean and through living and dead organisms. Fossil fuel also represents a reservoir of carbon. During photosynthesis comparatively large amount of carbon is fixed annually in the biosphere. And again a considerable amount of carbon is returned back to the atmosphere as <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> through the respiration of different flora and fauna. Decomposers also contribute substantially to the <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> pool by their processing of waste materials and dead organic matter of land or oceans. It is estimated that 4 × 10<sup>13</sup> kg of carbon is fixed in the biosphere through photosynthesis annually.
